identificationModule.briefTitle: CARDIOLOGIST Trial: Artificial Intelligence Enabled Electrocardiogram for Atrial Fibrillation Detection
identificationModule.officialTitle: Computer-assisted Atrial Fibrillation Risk Detection In Oral-anticoagulant Use, Lowering Stroke Risk, and Optimizing Guidance With an Intelligent Screening Tool (CARDIOLOGIST): a Pragmatic Randomized Controlled Trial

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a randomized controlled trial (RCT) to test a novel artificial intelligence (AI)-enabled electrocardiogram (ECG)-based screening tool for improving the diagnosis and management of Atrial Fibrillation.

armGroups.label: Intervention
armGroups.description: Patients randomized to intervention will have access to the screening tool.

armGroups.label: Control
armGroups.description: Patients randomized to control will continue routine practice.

interventions.name: AI-enabled ECG-based Screening Tool
interventions.description: Primary care clinicians in the intervention group had access to the report, which displayed whether the AI-ECG result was positive or negative. The system will send a message to corresponding physicians if positive finding.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients in emergency department or inpatient department
* Patients had at least 1 ECG
* Patients cared by non-cardiologist

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients without history of atrial fibrillation diagnosis.
* Patients without history of long-term NOAC or warfarin usage.
* Patients without history of hemorrhagic stoke or ishemic stroke.
* Patients with low eGFR (\<30 ml/min)
